solution:
The port the server attempted to bind to is already in use. Is a Minecraft server already running? Try changing the `server-port=` value in the `server.properties` file.
For Linux users, you can see what ports are in use and by what programs by running `netstat -ltp` as root. Then, you can kill the process using the port your Minecraft server is attempting to use by running `kill -9 [PID]`.
If all else fails, try rebooting your computer.
